They’re about patience, observation, and a keen understanding of human nature. After all, in the legal world, everyone is playing a game, and the best players know how to blend in while still gaining an edge.

First, relationships are everything. People underestimate how much influence and information can be extracted through seemingly innocuous conversations. A lunch here, a dinner there, a casual mention of a case in the right context—those are the moments when the most valuable information slips out. You don’t have to be confrontational. And that’s the beauty of it—most people don’t even realize they’re being used until it's too late.
